s.text: "Russians waited for a month and a half for Yeltsin to explain the crisis and how the country should fight it," the paper said Wednesday.
It is designed to be "a center of initiation to nature" for children, the paper said.
Then, "when he finally woke up," he immediately started making phone calls to world leaders about Kosovo because this "gave him a chance to feel himself a leader of a great power."
Izvestiya said the use of force against Yugoslavia would revive the Cold War.
"The government of Israel, the Jewish Agency and the organized leadership of world Jewry must wake up to the urgent need to take action in the face of the impending disaster."
